intro: Ligusticum peucedanoides var. longifolium, commonly known as long-leaved angelica, is a perennial herb native to eastern Asia. It features tall, slender stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, supporting large, compound leaves with long, narrow lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its roots are aromatic and have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in moist, fertile soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
